register.description: Global software cold and warm reset control. This register is auto-cleared. Only write 1 is possible. A read returns 0 only.

bitfield.description: Global COLD software reset control. This bit is reset only upon a global cold source of reset.

bitenum.description: Global COLD software reset is cleared.
Triggers a global COLD software reset. The software must ensure the SDRAM is properly put in sef-refresh mode before applying this reset.

bitfield.description: Global WARM software reset control. This bit is reset upon any global source of reset (warm and cold).

bitenum.description: Global warm software reset is cleared.
Triggers a global warm software reset.

register.description: This register logs the global reset sources. Each bit is set upon release of the domain reset signal. Must be cleared by software. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: TSHUT_IVA warm reset event. This is a source of global WARM reset.
TSHUT_DSPEVE warm reset event. This is a source of global WARM reset.
LLI warm reset event. This is a source of global WARM reset.
TSHUT_CORE warm reset event. This is a source of global WARM reset.
TSHUT_GPU warm reset event. This is a source of global WARM reset.
TSHUT_MPU warm reset event. This is a source of global WARM reset.
C2C warm reset event. This is a source of global WARM reset.
IcePick reset event. This is a source of global warm reset initiated by the emulation.
VDD_CORE voltage manager reset event This is a source of global WARM reset.

bitenum.description: VDD_CORE voltage manager reset has occurred.

bitfield.description: VDD_MM voltage manager reset event This is a source of global WARM reset.

bitenum.description: VDD_MM voltage manager reset has occurred.

bitfield.description: VDD_MPU voltage manager reset event This is a source of global WARM reset.

bitenum.description: VDD_MPU voltage manager reset has occurred.

bitfield.description: External warm reset event

bitenum.description: Global external warm reset has occurred.

bitfield.description: Secure Watchdog timer or HDCP reset event. This is a source of global WARM reset.

bitenum.description: Secure wachtdog or HDCP reset has occurred.

bitfield.description: WD_TIMER2 and MPU subsystem watchdog reset event. This is a source of global WARM reset.
Security violation reset event triggered by Security State Machine inside MPUSS. This is a source of global WARM reset.
Global warm software reset event

bitenum.description: Global warm SW reset has occurred.

bitfield.description: Power-on (cold) reset event

register.description: Reset duration control. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Power domain reset duration 2 in number of RM.SYSCLK clock cycles.
Global reset duration 1 in number of FUNC_32K_CLK clock cycles. This bit-field is only sensitive to the external power-on reset (WKUPAON_SYS_PWRON_RST reset line)

register.description: This register provides voltage domain management controls.

bitfield.description: This bit allows disabling I2C interface with powerIC for MM voltage (for debug purpose only). [warm reset insensitive]
This bit allows disabling I2C interface with powerIC for MPU voltage (for debug purpose only). [warm reset insensitive]
This bit allows disabling I2C interface with powerIC for CORE voltage (for debug purpose only). [warm reset insensitive]
This bit control the presence of MM voltage in device. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: MM voltage is not present as an individual voltage: MM voltage is merged with MPU voltage if VDD_MPU_presence=1. MM voltage is merged with CORE voltage if VDD_MPU_presence=0.
MM voltage is present on the device.

bitfield.description: This bit control the presence of MPU voltage in device. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: MPU voltage is not present as an individual voltage: MPU voltage is merged with MM voltage if VDD_MM_presence=1. MPU voltage is merged with CORE voltage if VDD_MM_presence=0.
MPU voltage is present on the device.

bitfield.description: This bit field specifies the state to which the hardware can automatically transition the VDD_MM_L voltage domain.

bitenum.description: Voltage domain transitions to SLEEP are enabled.
Voltage domain transitions to RET are enabled.

bitfield.description: This bit field specifies the state to which the hardware can automatically transition the VDD_MPU_L voltage domain.

bitenum.description: Voltage domain transitions to SLEEP are enabled.
Voltage domain transitions to RET are enabled.

bitfield.description: This bit field specifies the state to which the hardware can automatically transition the VDD_CORE_L voltage domain.

bitenum.description: Voltage domain transitions to SLEEP are enabled.
Voltage domain transitions to RET are enabled.

register.description: This register allows controlling the PWRREQ signal towards power IC.

bitfield.description: Control upon which condition from MPU, MM and CORE voltage domains PWRREQ is de-asserted.

bitenum.description: PWRREQ is de-asserted if all voltage domain are in SLEEP, RET or OFF state. Conversely, PWRREQ is asserted upon any voltage domain entering or staying in ON state.
PWRREQ is de-asserted if all voltage domain are in RET or OFF state. Conversely, PWRREQ is asserted upon any voltage domain entering or staying in ON or SLEEP state.
PWRREQ is de-asserted if all voltage domain are in OFF state. Conversely, PWRREQ is asserted upon any voltage domain entering or staying in ON or SLEEP or RET state.

register.description: This register allows controlling 2 parameters for power state controller. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: The value 'NbCycles' set in this field determines the duration of the PONOUT to PGOODIN transition for power domain without DPS. The duration is computed as 8 x NbCycles of system clock cycles. Target is 10us.

The value 'NbCycles' set in this field determines the duration of the PONOUT to PGOODIN transition for power domain without DPS. The duration is computed as 8 x NbCycles of system clock cycles. Target is 10us.
Number of system clock cycles for the SRAM pre-charge duration. Target is 600ns.

register.description: This register allows controlling DDR IO isolation removal setup. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Determines the setup time of the DDR IOs going out of isolation. Counting on the system clock. Target is 1.5us.

register.description: This register allows controlling power management features of the IOs.

bitfield.description: Global IO wakeup enable. This is a gating condition to all individual IO WUEN coming from control module. Gating is done in the Spinner logic.

bitenum.description: All individual IO WUEN are gated in the Spinner logic (overriden to 0).
All individual IO WUEN from control module are going to IOs.

bitfield.description: Gives value of WUCLKOUT signal coming back from IO pad ring.
Direct control on WUCLKIN signal to IO pad ring.

bitenum.description: WUCLKIN signal is driven to 0. IO wakeup daisy chain is functional as well as IO whose wakeup feature is enabled.
WUCLKIN signal is driven to 1. IO wakeup daisy chain is reset and is latching current pad states and WUEN inputs.

bitfield.description: Gives the functional status of the IO ring.

bitenum.description: Part or all of the IOs are not in the ON state, that is are in isolation state.
All IOs are in the ON state.

bitfield.description: Control non-EMIF IO isolation extension upon a device wakeup from OFF mode.

bitenum.description: Non-EMIF IO isolation is not extended. 'EMIF_ON' IO transition happens as soon as automatic restore is completed.
Non-EMIF IO isolation is extended. 'EMIF_ON' IO transition is stalled.

bitfield.description: Gives value of ISOCLKOUT signal coming back from IO pad ring.

Override control on ISOCLKIN signal to IO pad ring. Used at boot time when it is needed to change the mode of an IO from 1.8V default mode to 1.2V mode. When not overriden, this signal is controlled by hardware only.

bitenum.description: ISOCLKIN signal is overriden to active value ('1').

register.description: This register provides bit-fields for specifying voltage stabilization duration upon a global warm reset. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Determines prescaler for stabilization duration counting.

bitenum.description: Ramp-up counter is incremented every 32 system clock cycles
Ramp-up counter is incremented every 256 system clock cycles
Ramp-up counter is incremented every 2048 system clock cycles
Ramp-up counter is incremented every 16384 system clock cycles

bitfield.description: Determines the stabilization duration of all VDD_xxx_L regulators upon a global warm reset assertion. The duration is computed according to Stable_Prescal.

register.description: This register provides bit-fields for specifying voltage ramp-up and ramp-down times for PRM managed external regulators. These values are used for VDD_CORE_L domain transitions with OFF state. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Determines prescaler for ramp-down duration counting.

bitenum.description: Ramp-down counter is incremented every 64 system clock cycles
Ramp-down counter is incremented every 256 system clock cycles
Ramp-down counter is incremented every 512 system clock cycles
Ramp-down counter is incremented every 2048 system clock cycles

bitfield.description: Determines the ramp-down duration of VDD_CORE_L regulators. The duration is computed according to Ramp_Down_Prescal.
Determines prescaler for ramp-up duration counting.

bitenum.description: Ramp-up counter is incremented every 64 system clock cycles
Ramp-up counter is incremented every 256 system clock cycles
Ramp-up counter is incremented every 512 system clock cycles
Ramp-up counter is incremented every 2048 system clock cycles

bitfield.description: Determines the ramp-up duration of VDD_CORE_L regulators. The duration is computed according to Ramp_Up_Prescal. At cold reset, PRCM assumes that VDD_CORE_L will be at a valid ON voltage before SYS_NRESPWRON is de-asserted.

register.description: This register provides bit-fields for specifying voltage ramp-up and ramp-down times for PRM managed external regulators. These values are used for VDD_MPU_L domain transitions to or from OFF state. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Determines prescaler for ramp-down duration counting.

bitenum.description: Ramp-down counter is incremented every 64 system clock cycles
Ramp-down counter is incremented every 256 system clock cycles
Ramp-down counter is incremented every 512 system clock cycles
Ramp-down counter is incremented every 2048 system clock cycles

bitfield.description: Determines the ramp-down duration of VDD_MPU_L regulators. The duration is computed according to Ramp_Down_Prescal.
Determines prescaler for ramp-up duration counting.

bitenum.description: Ramp-up counter is incremented every 64 system clock cycles
Ramp-up counter is incremented every 256 system clock cycles
Ramp-up counter is incremented every 512 system clock cycles
Ramp-up counter is incremented every 2048 system clock cycles

bitfield.description: Determines the ramp-up duration of VDD_MPU_L regulators. The duration is computed according to Ramp_Up_Prescal. At cold reset, PRCM assumes that VDD_MPU_L will be at a valid ON voltage before SYS_NRESPWRON is de-asserted.

register.description: This register provides bit-fields for specifying voltage ramp-up and ramp-down times for PRM managed external regulators. These values are used for VDD_MM_L domain transitions to or from OFF state. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Determines prescaler for ramp-down duration counting.

bitenum.description: Ramp-down counter is incremented every 64 system clock cycles
Ramp-down counter is incremented every 256 system clock cycles
Ramp-down counter is incremented every 512 system clock cycles
Ramp-down counter is incremented every 2048 system clock cycles

bitfield.description: Determines the ramp-down duration of VDD_MM_L regulators. The duration is computed according to Ramp_Down_Prescal.
Determines prescaler for ramp-up duration counting.

bitenum.description: Ramp-up counter is incremented every 64 system clock cycles
Ramp-up counter is incremented every 256 system clock cycles
Ramp-up counter is incremented every 512 system clock cycles
Ramp-up counter is incremented every 2048 system clock cycles

bitfield.description: Determines the ramp-up duration of VDD_MM_L regulators. The duration is computed according to Ramp_Up_Prescal. At cold reset, PRCM assumes that VDD_MM_L will be at a valid ON voltage before SYS_NRESPWRON is de-asserted.

register.description: This register provides bit-fields for specifying voltage ramp-up and ramp-down times for PRM managed external regulators. These values are used for VDD_CORE_L domain transitions between ON and RET or SLEEP state. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Determines prescaler for ramp-down duration counting.

bitenum.description: Ramp-down counter is incremented every 64 system clock cycles
Ramp-down counter is incremented every 256 system clock cycles
Ramp-down counter is incremented every 512 system clock cycles
Ramp-down counter is incremented every 2048 system clock cycles

bitfield.description: Determines the ramp-down duration of VDD_CORE_L regulators. The duration is computed according to Ramp_Down_Prescal.
Determines prescaler for ramp-up duration counting.

bitenum.description: Ramp-up counter is incremented every 64 system clock cycles
Ramp-up counter is incremented every 256 system clock cycles
Ramp-up counter is incremented every 512 system clock cycles
Ramp-up counter is incremented every 2048 system clock cycles

bitfield.description: Determines the ramp-up duration of VDD_CORE_L regulators. The duration is computed according to Ramp_Up_Prescal.

register.description: This register provides bit-fields for specifying voltage ramp-up and ramp-down times for PRM managed external regulators. These values are used for VDD_MPU_L domain transitions between ON and RET or SLEEP state. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Determines prescaler for ramp-down duration counting.

bitenum.description: Ramp-down counter is incremented every 64 system clock cycles
Ramp-down counter is incremented every 256 system clock cycles
Ramp-down counter is incremented every 512 system clock cycles
Ramp-down counter is incremented every 2048 system clock cycles

bitfield.description: Determines the ramp-down duration of VDD_MPU_L regulators. The duration is computed according to Ramp_Down_Prescal.
Determines prescaler for ramp-up duration counting.

bitenum.description: Ramp-up counter is incremented every 64 system clock cycles
Ramp-up counter is incremented every 265 system clock cycles
Ramp-up counter is incremented every 512 system clock cycles
Ramp-up counter is incremented every 2048 system clock cycles

bitfield.description: Determines the ramp-up duration of VDD_MPU_L regulators. The duration is computed according to Ramp_Up_Prescal.

register.description: This register provides bit-fields for specifying voltage ramp-up and ramp-down times for PRM managed external regulators. These values are used for VDD_MM_L domain transitions between ON and RET or SLEEP state. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Determines prescaler for ramp-down duration counting.

bitenum.description: Ramp-down counter is incremented every 64 system clock cycles
Ramp-down counter is incremented every 256 system clock cycles
Ramp-down counter is incremented every 512 system clock cycles
Ramp-down counter is incremented every 2048 system clock cycles

bitfield.description: Determines the ramp-down duration of VDD_MM_L regulators. The duration is computed according to Ramp_Down_Prescal.
Determines prescaler for ramp-up duration counting.

bitenum.description: Ramp-up counter is incremented every 64 system clock cycles
Ramp-up counter is incremented every 256 system clock cycles
Ramp-up counter is incremented every 512 system clock cycles
Ramp-up counter is incremented every 2048 system clock cycles

register.description: This register allows the configuration of the Voltage Processor dedicated to CORE Voltage Domain (VDD_CORE_L).

bitfield.description: Offset value in the Error to Voltage converter (two's complement number).
Gain value in the Error to Voltage converter (two's complement number).
Set the initial voltage level of the SMPS.
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Enable or disable the timeout capability of the Voltage Controller State Machine.

bitenum.description: Timeout is disabled. Loop will wait indefinitely.
Timeout will occur when TIMEOUT cycles have elapsed.

bitfield.description: Initializes the voltage in the Voltage Processor.

bitenum.description: The positive edge of InitVdd triggers a write of the value in the InitVoltage into the Voltage Processor.

bitfield.description: Forces an update of the SMPS.

bitenum.description: The positive edge of ForceUpdate triggers an update of the voltage to the SMPS.

bitfield.description: Enables or disables the Voltage Processor updates on SR_SInterruptz.

register.description: This register reflects the idle state of the Voltage Processor dedicated to the CORE Voltage Domain (VDD_CORE_L. This register is read only and automatically updated.

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
CORE Voltage Processor idle status.

bitenum.description: The Voltage Processor for CORE is processing. Warm reset sensitive
The Voltage Processor for CORE is in idle state.

register.description: This register allows the configuration of the voltage limits and timeout values of the Voltage Processor dedicated to the CORE Voltage Domain (VDD_CORE_L).

bitfield.description: Defines the maximum voltage supply level.
Defines the minimum voltage supply level.
Defines Voltage Controller maximum wait time for responses.

register.description: This register indicates the current value of the SMPS voltage for the Voltage Processor dedicated to the CORE Voltage Domain (VDD_CORE_L).

bitfield.description: The time voltage processor needs to wait for SMPS to be settled after receiving SMPS acknowledge. This wait can only be used during force_update operation.
Indicates the current SMPS programmed voltage.

register.description: This register allows the programming of the maximum voltage step and waiting time of the Voltage Processor dedicated to CORE Voltage Domain (VDD_CORE_L).

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Slew rate for positive voltage step (in number of cycles per step).
Maximum voltage step

register.description: This register allows the programming of the minimum voltage step and waiting time of the Voltage Processor dedicated to the CORE Voltage Domain (VDD_CORE_L).

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Slew rate for negative voltage step (in number of cycles per step).
Minimum voltage step

register.description: This register allows the configuration of the Voltage Processor dedicated to MPU Voltage Domain (VDD_MPU_L).

bitfield.description: Offset value in the Error to Voltage converter (two's complement number).
Gain value in the Error to Voltage converter (two's complement number).
Set the initial voltage level of the SMPS.
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Enable or disable the timeout capability of the Voltage Controller State Machine.

bitenum.description: Timeout is disabled. Loop will wait indefinitely.
Timeout will occur when TIMEOUT cycles have elapsed.

bitfield.description: Initializes the voltage in the Voltage Processor.

bitenum.description: The positive edge of InitVdd triggers a write of the value in the InitVoltage into the Voltage Processor.

bitfield.description: Forces an update of the SMPS.

bitenum.description: The positive edge of ForceUpdate triggers an update of the voltage to the SMPS.

bitfield.description: Enables or disables the Voltage Processor updates on SR_SInterruptz.

register.description: This register reflects the idle state of the Voltage Processor dedicated to the MPU Voltage Domain (VDD_MPU_L. This register is read only and automatically updated.

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Voltage Processor 1 idle status.

bitenum.description: The Voltage Processor 1 is in idle state.

register.description: This register allows the configuration of the voltage limits and timeout values of the Voltage Processor dedicated to the MPU Voltage Domain (VDD_MPU_L).

bitfield.description: Defines the maximum voltage supply level.
Defines the minimum voltage supply level.
Defines Voltage Controller maximum wait time for responses.

register.description: This register indicates the current value of the SMPS voltage for the Voltage Processor dedicated to the MPU Voltage Domain (VDD_MPU_L).

bitfield.description: The time voltage processor needs to wait for SMPS to be settled after receiving SMPS acknowledge. This wait only be used during force_update operation.
Indicates the current SMPS programmed voltage.

register.description: This register allows the programming of the maximum voltage step and waiting time of the Voltage Processor dedicated to MPU Voltage Domain (VDD_MPU_L).

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Slew rate for positive voltage step (in number of cycles per step).
Maximum voltage step

register.description: This register allows the programming of the minimum voltage step and waiting time of the Voltage Processor dedicated to the MPU Voltage Domain (VDD_MPU_L).

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Slew rate for negative voltage step (in number of cycles per step).
Minimum voltage step

register.description: This register allows the configuration of the Voltage Processor dedicated to MM Voltage Domain (VDD_MM_L).

bitfield.description: Offset value in the Error to Voltage converter (two's complement number).
Gain value in the Error to Voltage converter (two's complement number).
Set the initial voltage level of the SMPS.
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Enable or disable the timeout capability of the Voltage Controller State Machine.

bitenum.description: Timeout is disabled. Loop will wait indefinitely.
Timeout will occur when TIMEOUT cycles have elapsed.

bitfield.description: Initializes the voltage in the Voltage Processor.

bitenum.description: The positive edge of InitVdd triggers a write of the value in the InitVoltage into the Voltage Processor.

bitfield.description: Forces an update of the SMPS.

bitenum.description: The positive edge of ForceUpdate triggers an update of the voltage to the SMPS.

bitfield.description: Enables or disables the Voltage Processor updates on SR_SInterruptz.

register.description: This register reflects the idle state of the Voltage Processor dedicated to the MPU Voltage Domain (VDD_MM_L. This register is read only and automatically updated.

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Voltage Processor 1 idle status.

bitenum.description: The Voltage Processor 1 is in idle state.

register.description: This register allows the configuration of the voltage limits and timeout values of the Voltage Processor dedicated to the MM voltage Domain (VDD_MM_L).

bitfield.description: Defines the maximum voltage supply level.
Defines the minimum voltage supply level.
Defines Voltage Controller maximum wait time for responses.

register.description: This register indicates the current value of the SMPS voltage for the Voltage Processor dedicated to the MM voltage Domain (VDD_MM_L).

bitfield.description: The time voltage processor needs to wait for SMPS to be settled after receiving SMPS acknowledge. This wait only be used during force_update operation.
Indicates the current SMPS programmed voltage.

register.description: This register allows the programming of the maximum voltage step and waiting time of the Voltage Processor dedicated to MM voltage Domain (VDD_MM_L).

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Slew rate for positive voltage step (in number of cycles per step).
Maximum voltage step

register.description: This register allows the programming of the minimum voltage step and waiting time of the Voltage Processor dedicated to the MM voltage Domain (VDD_MM_L).

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Slew rate for negative voltage step (in number of cycles per step).
Minimum voltage step

register.description: This register allows the setting of the I2C slave address of the Power IC device, the setting of the voltage configuration register address for the CORE VDD and the Command (ON/ON-Low-Power/Retention/OFF) configuration register address values for CORE VDD (if used SMPS chips have different command configuration register than voltage configuration register). [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Command values (ON/ON-Low-Power/Retention/OFF voltage values) set selection for VDD_CORE_L channel

bitenum.description: VDD_CORE_L channel use VC_VAL_CMD_VDD_MPU_L set for command values
VDD_CORE_L channel use VC_VAL_CMD_VDD_CORE_L set for command values

bitfield.description: Enable bit for usage of RAC_VDD_CORE_L

bitenum.description: VDD_CORE_L channel uses VOLRA values for register address of VFSM-s commands. VFSM-s commands goes also to voltage configuration register.
VDD_CORE_L channel uses CMDRA values for register address of VFSM-s commands. VFSM-s commands goes to different command configuration register.

bitfield.description: Command (ON/ON-Low-Power/Retention/OFF) configuration register address pointer for VDD_CORE_L channel
Voltage configuration register address pointer for VDD_CORE_L channel.
Slave address pointer for VDD_CORE_L channel.
Command (ON/ON-Low-Power /Retention/OFF) configuration register address value for VDD_CORE_L channel.(if VDD_CORE_L source has different command configuration register than voltage VDD_MPU_L)
Set the voltage configuration register address value for the VDD_CORE_L channel (if VDD_CORE_L source is placed in same chip as VDD_MPU_L source and have different voltage configuration register)
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Set the I2C slave address value for the first Power IC device.

register.description: This register allows the setting of the I2C slave address of the Power IC device, the setting of the voltage configuration register address for the MM VDD and the Command (ON/ON-Low-Power/Retention/OFF) configuration register address values for MM VDD (if used SMPS chips have different command configuration register than voltage configuration register).. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Command values (ON/ON-Low-Power/Retention/OFF voltage values) set selection for VDD_MM_L channel

bitenum.description: VDD_MM_L channel use VC_VAL_CMD_VDD_MPU_L set for command values
VDD_MM_L channel use VC_VAL_CMD_VDD_MM_L set for command values

bitfield.description: Enable bit for usage of RAC_VDD_MM_L

bitenum.description: VDD_MM_L channel uses VOLRA values for register address of VFSM-s commands. VFSM-s commands goes also to voltage configuration register.
VDD_MM_L channel uses CMDRA values for register address of VFSM-s commands. VFSM-s commands goes to different command configuration register.

bitfield.description: Command (ON/ON-Low-Power/Retention/OFF) configuration register address pointer for VDD_MM_L channel
Voltage configuration register address pointer for VDD_MM_L channel.
Slave address pointer for VDD_MM_L channel.
Command (ON/ON-Low-Power /Retention/OFF) configuration register address value for VDD_MM_L channel (if VDD_MM_L source has different command configuration register than voltage VDD_MPU_L)
Voltage configuration register address value for VDD_MM_L channel (if VDD_MM_L source is placed in same chip as VDD_MPU_L source and have different voltage configuration register)
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Set the I2C slave address value for the second (if any) Power IC device.

register.description: This register allows the setting of the I2C slave address of the Power IC device, the setting of the voltage configuration register address for the MPU VDD and the Command (ON/ON-Low-Power/Retention/OFF) configuration register address values for MPU VDD (if used SMPS chips have different command configuration register than voltage configuration register). [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Command values (ON/ON-Low-Power/Retention/OFF voltage values) set selection for VDD_MPU_L channel (This bit has no influence on VDD_MPU_L channel)
Enable bit for usage of RAC_VDD_MPU_L

bitenum.description: VDD_MPU_L channel uses VOLRA values for register address of VFSM-s commands. VFSM-s commands goes also to voltage configuration register.
VDD_MPU_L channel uses CMDRA values for register address of VFSM-s commands. VFSM-s commands goes to different command configuration register.

bitfield.description: Command (ON/ON-Low-Power/Retention/OFF) configuration register address pointer for VDD_MPU_L channel. (This bit has no influence on first VDD_MPU_L channel)
Voltage configuration register address pointer for VDD_MPU_L channel. (This bit has no influence on first VDD_MPU_L channel)
Slave address pointer for VDD_MPU_L channel. (This bit has no influence on first VDD_MPU_L channel)
Command (ON/ON-Low-Power /Retention/OFF) configuration register address value for VDD_MPU_L channel.
Voltage configuration register address value for VDD_MPU_L channel.
Write 0's for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Set the I2C slave address value for the third (if any) Power IC device.

register.description: This register allows the setting of the ON/ON-Low-Power/Retention/OFF command values for VDD_CORE_L channel. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Set the ON command value.
Set the ON-Low-Power command value.
Set the RET command value.
Set the OFF command value.

register.description: This register allows the setting of the ON/ON-Low-Power/Retention/OFF command values for VDD_MM_L channel. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Set the ON command value.
Set the ON-Low-Power command value.
Set the RET command value.
Set the OFF command value.

register.description: This register allows the setting of the ON/ON-Low-Power/Retention/OFF command values for VDD_MPU_L channel. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Set the ON command value.
Set the ON-Low-Power command value.
Set the RET command value.
Set the OFF command value.

register.description: Bypass data values register used for bypass command channel to send other configuration information (other then voltage configuration parameters) for SMPS chips which have no other configuration interface then this I2C interface and flag to indicate OPP change to EMIF to allow read/write leveling. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: This bit controls read-write leveling of EMIF memories (DDR3). It must be set in case OPP voltage change is done through Voltage Controller whithout passing through Voltage processor.
This bit validates the bypass command. It is automatically cleared by HW either after getting the acknowledge back from the SMPS or if an error occurred.

bitenum.description: The last command send has been acknowledged

bitfield.description: Data to send to the Power IC device.
Set the address of Power IC device register to configure.
Set the I2C slave address value.

register.description: This debug register logs CORE related error status coming from Voltage Controller. Must be cleared by software.

bitfield.description: CORE voltage FSM command frame is finished but is not acknowledged by the slave, or (I2C multimaster) arbitration lost.
Wrong register address error for CORE voltage FSM
Wrong slave address error for CORE voltage FSM
CORE voltage processor command frame is finished but is not acknowledged by the slave, or (I2C multimaster) arbitration lost.
Wrong register address error for CORE voltage processor
Wrong slave address error for CORE voltage processor

register.description: This debug register logs MM related error status coming from Voltage Controller. Must be cleared by software.

bitfield.description: MM voltage FSM command frame is finished but is not acknowledged by the slave, or (I2C multimaster) arbitration lost.
Wrong register address error for MM voltage FSM
Wrong slave address error for MM voltage FSM
MM voltage processor command frame is finished but is not acknowledged by the slave, or (I2C multimaster) arbitration lost.
Wrong register address error for MM voltage processor
Wrong slave address error for MM voltage processor

register.description: This debug register logs MPU related error status coming from Voltage Controller. Must be cleared by software.

bitfield.description: MPU voltage FSM command frame is finished but is not acknowledged by the slave, or (I2C multimaster) arbitration lost.
Wrong register address error for MPU voltage FSM
Wrong slave address error for MPU voltage FSM
MPU voltage processor command frame is finished but is not acknowledged by the slave, or (I2C multimaster) arbitration lost.
Wrong register address error for MPU voltage processor
Wrong slave address error for MPU voltage processor

register.description: This debug register logs BYPASS related error status coming from Voltage Controller. Must be cleared by software.

bitfield.description: BYPASS command frame is finished but is not acknowledged by the slave, or (I2C multimaster) arbitration lost.
Wrong register address error for BYPASS command
Wrong slave address error for BYPASS command

register.description: I2C configuration register. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: This field enables double filter procedure for I2C input lines

bitenum.description: I2C bus digital filter rejects all glitches smaller than 1 sytem clock cycle
I2C bus digital filter rejects all glitches smaller than 2 sytem clock cycle

bitfield.description: Enables the I2C repeated start operation mode (effect of holding the SCL and SDA lines low, in effect blocking the I2C bus from losing arbitration between repeated start points). Use of this feature results from a trade-off between speed and power consumption of I2C interface.

bitenum.description: Disables the repeated start operation mode
Enables the repeated start operation mode

bitfield.description: Enables I2C bus High Speed mode.

bitenum.description: Disables the I2C high speed mode
Enables the I2C high speed mode

bitfield.description: Master code value for I2C High Speed preamble transmission.

register.description: I2C Interface clock configuration parameters. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Number of the system clock cycles, necessary to count the low period of the I2C clock signal, when the I2C interface runs in High-Speed mode of operation.
Number of the system clock cycles, necessary to count the high period of the I2C clock signal, when the I2C interface runs in High-Speed mode of operation.
Number of the system clock cycles, necessary to count the low period of the I2C clock signal, when the I2C interface runs in Fast mode of operation.
Number of the system clock cycles, necessary to count the high period of the I2C clock signal, when the I2C interface runs in Fast mode of operation.

register.description: Common setup for SRAM LDO transition counters. Applies to all voltage domains. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Determines the start-up duration of SRAM and ABB LDO. The duration is computed as 16 x NbCycles of system clock cycles. Target is 50us.
Delay between retention/off assertion of last SRAM bank and SRAMALLRET signal to LDO is driven high. Counting on system clock. Target is 2us.
SRAM LDO rampup time from retention to active mode. The duration is computed as 8 x NbCycles of system clock cycles. Target is 30us.
Delay between de-assertion of standby_rta_ret_on and standby_rta_ret_good. Counting on system clock. Target is 600ns.

register.description: Setup of memory in WKUP voltage domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Control for HD memory RTA feature. After PowerOn reset and Efuse sensing, this bitfield is automatically loaded with an Efuse value from control module. Bitfield remains writable after this.

bitenum.description: HD memory RTA feature is disabled
HD memory RTA feature is enabled

register.description: Setup of the SRAM LDO for CORE voltage domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Override on AIPOFF input of SRAM LDO.

bitenum.description: AIPOFF signal is overriden to '1'. Corresponding SRAM LDO is disabled and in HZ mode.

bitfield.description: ENFUNC5 input of SRAM LDO.

bitenum.description: Active to retention is a one step transfer
Active to retention is a two steps transfer

bitfield.description: ENFUNC4 input of SRAM LDO.
ENFUNC3 input of SRAM LDO. After PowerOn reset and Efuse sensing, this bitfield is automatically loaded with an Efuse value from control module. Bitfield remains writable after this.
ENFUNC2 input of SRAM LDO. After PowerOn reset and Efuse sensing, this bitfield is automatically loaded with an Efuse value from control module. Bitfield remains writable after this.
ENFUNC1 input of SRAM LDO. After PowerOn reset and Efuse sensing, this bitfield is automatically loaded with an Efuse value from control module. Bitfield remains writable after this.

Determines whether SRAMNWA is supplied by VDDS or VDDAR during deep-sleep. After PowerOn reset and Efuse sensing, this bitfield is automatically loaded with an Efuse value from control module. Bitfield remains writable after this.

Determines whether SRAMNWA is supplied by VDDS or VDDAR during active mode. After PowerOn reset and Efuse sensing, this bitfield is automatically loaded with an Efuse value from control module. Bitfield remains writable after this.
Control for HD memory RTA feature. After PowerOn reset and Efuse sensing, this bitfield is automatically loaded with an Efuse value from control module. Bitfield remains writable after this.

bitenum.description: HD memory RTA feature is disabled
HD memory RTA feature is enabled

register.description: Control and status of the SRAM LDO for CORE voltage domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Status indicating SRAM LDO state machine state.

bitenum.description: SRAM LDO state machine is stable
SRAM LDO state machine is in transition state

bitfield.description: SRAMLDO status
Control if the SRAM LDO retention mode is used or not.

bitenum.description: SRAM LDO is not allowed to go to RET mode

register.description: Setup of the SRAM LDO for MPU voltage domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Override on AIPOFF input of SRAM LDO.

bitenum.description: AIPOFF signal is overriden to '1'. Corresponding SRAM LDO is disabled and in HZ mode.

bitfield.description: ENFUNC5 input of SRAM LDO.

bitenum.description: Active to retention is a one step transfer
Active to retention is a two steps transfer

bitfield.description: ENFUNC4 input of SRAM LDO.

bitenum.description: HD memory RTA feature is disabled
HD memory RTA feature is enabled

register.description: Control and status of the SRAM LDO for MPU voltage domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Status indicating SRAM LDO state machine state.

bitenum.description: SRAM LDO state machine is stable
SRAM LDO state machine is in transition state

bitfield.description: SRAMLDO status
Control if the SRAM LDO retention mode is used or not.

bitenum.description: SRAM LDO is not allowed to go to RET mode
SRAM LDO go to RET mode when all memory of voltage domain are OFF or RET

bitfield.description: Override on AIPOFF input of SRAM LDO.

bitenum.description: Active to retention is a one step transfer
Active to retention is a two steps transfer

bitfield.description: ENFUNC4 input of SRAM LDO.
ENFUNC3 input of SRAM LDO. After PowerOn reset and Efuse sensing, this bitfield is automatically loaded with an Efuse value from control module. Bitfield remains writable after this.
ENFUNC2 input of SRAM LDO. After PowerOn reset and Efuse sensing, this bitfield is automatically loaded with an Efuse value from control module. Bitfield remains writable after this.
ENFUNC1 input of SRAM LDO. After PowerOn reset and Efuse sensing, this bitfield is automatically loaded with an Efuse value from control module. Bitfield remains writable after this.

Determines whether SRAMNWA is supplied by VDDS or VDDAR during deep-sleep. After PowerOn reset and Efuse sensing, this bitfield is automatically loaded with an Efuse value from control module. Bitfield remains writable after this.

Determines whether SRAMNWA is supplied by VDDS or VDDAR during active mode. After PowerOn reset and Efuse sensing, this bitfield is automatically loaded with an Efuse value from control module. Bitfield remains writable after this.

bitenum.description: HD memory RTA feature is disabled
HD memory RTA feature is enabled

register.description: Control and status of the SRAM LDO for GPU voltage domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Status indicating SRAM LDO state machine state.

bitenum.description: SRAM LDO state machine is stable
SRAM LDO state machine is in transition state

bitfield.description: SRAMLDO status
Control if the SRAM LDO retention mode is used or not.

bitenum.description: SRAM LDO is not allowed to go to RET mode
SRAM LDO go to RET mode when all memory of voltage domain are OFF or RET

register.description: Selects the MPU_ABB LDO mode.

bitfield.description: LDO settling time for active-mode OPP change. Counting at a 16 system clock cycles rate. Target is 50us. [warm reset insensitive]
Defines ABB LDO mode when voltage is in slow fast OPP. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: ABB LDO is in bypass mode
ABB LDO is in FBB mode

bitfield.description: Enable ABB power management

bitenum.description: ABB LDO is put in bypass mode
ABB LDO will operate accordingly to settings

register.description: Control and Status of ABB on MPU voltage domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Indicates VBBLDO_CON is or is not in transition state. This output should be used by programming interface to clear OPP_CHANGE bit as an indication of OPP change completion.

bitenum.description: Indicates that VBBLDO_CON is in transition and SR2_STATUS bits are not stable to read.

bitfield.description: Indicate ABB LDO current operation status

bitenum.description: ABB LDO is placed in bypass mode.
ABB LDO is placed in FBB active mode.

bitfield.description: When OPP_CHANGE is set to 1, VBBLDO_CON samples OPP_SEL ACTIVE_FBB_SEL upon detecting rising edge. VBBLDO_CON asserts signal SR2_IN_TRANSITION in response to OPP_CHANGE. OPP_CHANGE should be cleared to 0 when SR2_IN_TRANSITION from VBBLDO_CON is de-asserted.
To control the ABB LDO (FBB/RBB) at a given OPP, set to 0x1. Refer to.

register.description: Selects the GPU_ABB LDO mode.

bitfield.description: LDO settling time for active-mode OPP change. Counting at a 16 system clock cycles rate. Target is 50us. [warm reset insensitive]
Defines ABB LDO mode when voltage is in slow fast OPP. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: ABB LDO is in bypass mode
ABB LDO is in FBB mode

bitfield.description: Enable ABB power management

bitenum.description: ABB LDO is put in bypass mode
ABB LDO will operate accordingly to settings

register.description: Control and Status of ABB on GPU voltage domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Indicates VBBLDO_CON is or is not in transition state. This output should be used by programming interface to clear OPP_CHANGE bit as an indication of OPP change completion.

bitenum.description: Indicates that VBBLDO_CON is in transition and SR2_STATUS bits are not stable to read.

bitfield.description: Indicate ABB LDO current operation status

bitenum.description: ABB LDO is placed in bypass mode.
ABB LDO is placed in FBB active mode.

bitfield.description: When OPP_CHANGE is set to 1, VBBLDO_CON samples OPP_SEL ACTIVE_FBB_SEL upon detecting rising edge. VBBLDO_CON asserts signal SR2_IN_TRANSITION in response to OPP_CHANGE. OPP_CHANGE should be cleared to 0 when SR2_IN_TRANSITION from VBBLDO_CON is de-asserted.
To control the ABB LDO (FBB/RBB) at a given OPP, set to 0x1. Refer to.

register.description: Setup of the bandgap. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Determines the start-up duration of BANDGAP. The duration is computed as 32 x NbCycles of system clock cycles. Target is 100us.

register.description: This register is used to control device OFF transition.

bitfield.description: Controls the EMIF2_DEVICE_OFFWKUP_CORESRTACTST notifier sent to EMIF1 upon a device wakeup from OFF mode. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Notifier is not activated - stays low

bitfield.description: Controls the EMIF1_DEVICE_OFFWKUP_CORESRTACTST notifier sent to EMIF2 upon a device wakeup from OFF mode. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Notifier is not activated - stays low

bitfield.description: Controls transition to device OFF mode.

bitenum.description: Device is not allowed to perform transition to OFF mode
Device is allowed to perform transition to OFF mode as soon as all power domains in MPU, MM and CORE voltage are in OFF or OSWRET state (open switch retention)

register.description: This register stores the start descriptor address of automatic restore phase1. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Start descriptor address of automatic restore phase1. Hard-coded to SAR_ROM base address.

register.description: This register stores the start descriptor address of automatic restore phase2A. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Start descriptor address of automatic restore phase2A. Hard-coded to SAR_ROM base address + 0x30.

register.description: This register stores the start descriptor address of automatic restore phase2B. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Start descriptor address of automatic restore phase2B. Hard-coded to SAR_ROM base address + 0x60.

register.description: This register is used to control dedicated interfaces between on-chip modem and APE.

bitfield.description: Controls an interrupt signal to shutdown modem.
Controls an interrupt signal to wakeup modem.

register.description: This register provides a status on the current MPU voltage domain state. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Domain transition status

bitenum.description: No on-going transition on voltage domain
Voltage domain transition is in progress.

bitfield.description: Current voltage state status

register.description: This register provides a status on the current MM voltage domain state. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Domain transition status

bitenum.description: No on-going transition on voltage domain
Voltage domain transition is in progress.

bitfield.description: Current voltage state status

bitenum.description: HD memory RTA feature is disabled
HD memory RTA feature is enabled

register.description: Control and Status of ABB on DSPEVE voltage domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Indicates VBBLDO_CON is or is not in transition state. This output should be used by programming interface to clear OPP_CHANGE bit as an indication of OPP change completion.

bitenum.description: Indicates that VBBLDO_CON is in transition and SR2_STATUS bits are not stable to read.Updated PRM_ABBLDO_DSPEVE_CTRL register description.

bitfield.description: Indicate ABB LDO current operation status

bitenum.description: ABB LDO is placed in bypass mode.
ABB LDO is placed in FBB active mode.

bitfield.description: When OPP_CHANGE is set to 1, VBBLDO_CON samples OPP_SEL ACTIVE_FBB_SEL upon detecting rising edge. VBBLDO_CON asserts signal SR2_IN_TRANSITION in response to OPP_CHANGE. OPP_CHANGE should be cleared to 0 when SR2_IN_TRANSITION from VBBLDO_CON is de-asserted.
To control the ABB LDO (FBB/RBB) at a given OPP, set to 0x1. Refer to.

bitfield.description: Indicate ABB LDO current operation status

bitenum.description: ABB LDO is placed in bypass mode.
ABB LDO is placed in FBB active mode.

bitfield.description: When OPP_CHANGE is set to 1, VBBLDO_CON samples OPP_SEL ACTIVE_FBB_SEL upon detecting rising edge. VBBLDO_CON asserts signal SR2_IN_TRANSITION in response to OPP_CHANGE. OPP_CHANGE should be cleared to 0 when SR2_IN_TRANSITION from VBBLDO_CON is de-asserted.
To control the ABB LDO (FBB/RBB) at a given OPP, set to 0x1. Refer to.
